references.paper_title: Optimal strategies and minimax lower bounds for online convex games
references.reason: This paper establishes minimax lower bounds for online convex games, which are fundamental to understanding the optimality of online learning algorithms.
This paper introduces the concept of gradient variation and derives regret bounds that scale with this quantity, offering a more refined analysis compared to traditional regret bounds.
This paper provides a comprehensive analysis of online learning with predictable sequences and its implications for attaining fast convergence rates in online settings.

references.paper_title: Fast convergence of regularized learning in games
references.reason: This paper demonstrates fast convergence rates for learning in games by leveraging gradient variation, highlighting its importance in game-theoretic settings.
This book provides a foundational overview of online convex optimization, covering key concepts, algorithms, and applications that underpin many aspects of online learning.
